definition: to burst with rage/to blow one's top
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to explode
to deep fry/Taiwan pr. [zha4]

sentences.english: It made my blood boil to see my son stealing money from my wallet.
sentences.chinese: 我看见我儿子从我钱包里偷钱，肺都气炸了。

sentences.english: That old boy is going to explode soon.
sentences.chinese: 老家伙马上就要气炸了。

sentences.english: I almost blew my top when I found out that I had failed the test.
sentences.chinese: 当我发现我考砸了时，我简直快气炸了。

sentences.english: I feel as sick as a parrot. It's a game of two halves.
sentences.chinese: 我快气炸了，这是两个半场的比赛。

sentences.english: I almaximum blew my top when I searched out those IT had be lying to me.
sentences.chinese: 当我呈现她一直在对我说谎时，我简直快气炸了。

sentences.english: He felt he would burst with anger and shame.
sentences.chinese: 他恼羞成怒，都要气炸了。

sentences.english: When I told my mom I would be home around 2 am she had a cow!
sentences.chinese: 我跟我妈说我会到半夜二点才回家她气炸了。

sentences.english: When I told my mom I would be home around 2 am, she had kittens!
sentences.chinese: 我跟我妈说我会到半夜二点才回家，她气炸了。

sentences.english: I'm so frustrated with my 14-year-old son, I am about to explode.
sentences.chinese: 我14岁的儿子让我感觉很沮丧，他快把我给气炸了。

sentences.english: He saw red when he lost his money.
sentences.chinese: 当他遗失钱的时候，他火冒三丈气炸了。

sentences.english: I almost blew my top when I found out that she had been lying to me .
sentences.chinese: 当我发现他一直在对我说谎时，我简直快气炸了。

sentences.english: He blew up at her when she accused him of being a pervert.
sentences.chinese: 当她指控他是性变态者，他气炸了。

sentences.english: Now, finally, the two halves are connected.
sentences.chinese: 我快气炸了，这是两个半场的比赛。

sentences.english: Unless you're a robot, you are bound to blow your top.
sentences.chinese: 除非你是个机器人，否则定会被气炸。

definition: to get really angry
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to be angry about sth but also find it laughable
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to abuse roundly
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to get mad/to be very angry
lit. to pour dog's blood on (idiom)/fig. torrent of abuse
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
torrent of abuse (idiom)
to get angry/to burn with rage
to get angry/to fume
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to terrify/to scare sb
